runs.comm: flat, angled in on middle stump, goes on the back foot and punches it down the ground to long-on
length ball angling into off stump, defended off the back foot, back to the bowler
a bit slower now, and Williamson has time to rock back and smack it hard into the covers. Sean Williams dives to his right at cover and stops the ball. Could have been four otherwise
length ball, a lot of width outside off, and Williamson thanks him and flat-bats the ball over extra cover
slower and fuller on off stump. Williamson takes a step out of his crease and lifts it over extra cover once again, one bounce and over the rope

another man was brought into the cover region before this ball, but no one on the boundary - all the boundary fielders are on the leg side. Again Utseya serves one up on an off-stump line, and Williamson gets under it and lofts it over the covers
length ball outside off, flat-bat drive into the cover region
length ball on off stump, and Guptill slides away from his stumps to make a bit of room, and hits it through the line, with a straight bat, and lifts the ball over mid-off
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs it down to third man
shortish outside off and Williamson gets on his toes to force it away to the right of the diving backward point fielder. Super shot, and that's his fourth boundary already
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched to backward point

back of a length, angled into middle and off, Williamson opens up and works the ball towards mid-on. They run a quick single, and Williamson has to stretch to beat the throw in. It's a direct hit at the bowler's end, and the umpire doesn't go to the third umpire. Replays show he may have been out by a millimeter or so.
back of a length, angling into the body, looks to get on his toes and work it leg side, and is a little early into his shot. Leading edge pops up into the off side, to the left of the bowler
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish outside off, slapped into the covers
digs it in short on off stump, hurries through and Guptill decides not to play at it. Was shaping to pull, initially
slower ball outside off and Guptill doesn't pick it. Goes for the big cross-bat heave and doesn't connect
on the pads now, tucked quietly towards midwicket

short ball angled into the body, and Williamson has holed out. Opened up at the hips to pull it, and ended up hitting it in the air. Ervine, the fielder at deep square leg took it well, diving to his right and getting both hands to the ball
full on off stump, overpitched, and Guptill makes a bit of room by coming forward but not going across, and driving inside-out between cover and mid-off
back of a length close to off stump. Rides the bounce and defends towards point
slower ball, back of a length. Not much room but Guptill still manages to get on his toes and punch it away through point
length ball outside off, driven on the up between cover and cover point. Raza dived to his left from cover, got a hand on it
back of a length, angling across the left-hander, who leaves it alone
short ball, sits up nicely and Guptill pulls it away, into the gap to the left of the short fine leg fielder
slower ball, angling into middle stump, clipped away to the left of deep square leg
slower ball, full on the pads, clipped to midwicket
shortish, close to off stump, not short enough to pull. Sneaks under Guptill's bat and hurries through
slower ball outside off, comes forward and pushes it gently towards mid-off
short ball, hurries through at shoulder height and hurries Worker, who goes for the hook, doesn't connect too well, but keeps it down, sending it rolling towards short fine leg
length ball, too straight, angles down leg and Guptill misses the flick but gets enough pad on it to get it past the keeper and down to the fine leg boundary
length ball angling into middle and leg. Comes forward, stays inside the line, and dabs it towards cover point with an open bat face
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
very full on middle stump, jabbed down to mid-off
short ball angling across. Worker misses the pull, and the ball sneaks under his bat and pings Chakabva's gloves behind the stumps. Doesn't hold on to it, but I don't think he bottom-edged it
another shortish ball, another missed pull. This one hits him on the chest
tossed up outside off, driven away to sweeper cover
flat now, angled across quick towards middle stump. Goes on the back foot to flick, misses, is hit on the pad, but that pitched outside leg stump
a touch too straight as Worker comes down the track, and he gets a little tickle on the ball to put it in the gap to the left of short fine leg
full on middle stump, drives inside-out to long-off
tossed up on middle and leg, swept to short fine leg
slower ball, a touch short, sits up nicely outside off and Guptill waits on the back foot, keeps a nice stable base, and pulls it witheringly to the midwicket boundary
fuller now, on off stump, driven down to long-off
full on off stump, a bit of shape in to cramp the batsman, driven back towards the bowler
slower ball, and again a touch short on off stump. Worker swings it away over backward square leg, didn't go too hard at it, and still it carried all the way over the rope
length ball on middle and off, swiped away towards deep square leg
short and wide and that's easy pickings. Just opens his bat face and guides it down to the third man boundary
flat, angled into middle stump. Goes on the back foot and looks to work it towards long-on. The bowler gives chase and stops the ball
down the track, and Williams sees him coming and fires it in quick. Looks to hit over the top, inside-edges into his pads
full and flat on middle stump, worked away towards deep backward square leg
gone! Came down the track there, met the ball on the full, and hit through the line, fairly cleanly, but ended up picking out the man on the long-off boundary
length ball on leg stump, goes on the back foot to tuck it away towards deep square leg
down the track, drives inside out to long-off, from a middle-stump line
shortish on off stump, goes back and punches it into the deep point region
down the track now and Cremer tucks him up with a full ball at his feet. Driven down to long-on
shortish, goes on with the angle towards off stump. Worker goes on the back foot and punches into the covers
down the track to the tossed-up ball, and he has enough swinging room to launch that with the turn, over wide long-on
back of a length on off stump, keeps a touch low. Goes on the back foot and slaps it into the covers
a bit of flight again, swept away to deep square leg
flat, back of a length on off stump, whipped away towards deep midwicket
tossed up, slanting across the batsman, sliced in the air towards deep point
full on middle stump, and that is great fielding. Looked to clip it down the ground to long-on, but Raza dived to his right, full-length, and cut it off
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
sees him coming down the track and shortens his length outside off. Slapped away towards deep point
floated up full and wide, jams his bat down on it and stabs it towards short third man
length ball on middle and leg, lets it spin and defends it back to the bowler

a bit more flight, on leg stump, drops on a good length, and it produces the wicket. Elliott clears his front leg to hit it over the top, and ends up hitting straighter than he would have liked, picks out long-on
tossed up on a good length, turns sharply from off stump and ends up spinning down the leg side
back of a length outside off, punched to long-off
tossed up on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
length ball outside off, comes forward, lets it come on, and dabs it towards short third man
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
a gentle, loopy seamer outside off and Worker comes down the track and drills it to the cover boundary
short ball close to off stump, and that is pulled dismissively, off the front foot, over the straight midwicket boundary
fuller now, driven to long-off
full on middle and off, driven down the ground to long-on
flat and full on middle and leg, driven hard down the ground, and long-on has to dive to his right to save the boundary
full again, driven inside-out into the covers
down the track and Cremer shortens his length well, forces Worker to stretch out and poke the ball into the covers
shortish, a bit of width, cut away to the left of sweeper cover
a bit of flight and Worker likes that. Shimmies down the track, gets inside the line, and lofts it clean and crisp over long-on to bring up a half-century on debut
tossed up down the leg side and he's escaped punishment, Worker sweeping too close to short fine leg to pick up more than a single
flighted ball outside off, and that gives Ronchi swinging room. Gets down on one knee and slogs it high over wide long-on
flatter now, angled into the pads, tucked away towards deep midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, pulled away to deep square leg

down the track and Raza shifts his line wider. Reaches out and slices it in the air to the left of sweeper cover. They come back for a third, and Muzarabani's throw is to the keeper's end. It's a bit weak, the keeper has to go out to collect it, and Chakabva himself has a shy at the now unguarded stumps. He misses them, and the ball runs away for four overthrows
length ball on off stump, punched back towards the bowler
a bit slower now, on middle and leg, swept away to deep square leg
flat, angling into middle stump. Stays on the back foot and whips it down to long-on
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket

flat, angled into middle stump. Wasn't exactly a short ball but he goes deep in his crease to make it a short ball. Pulls in the air, and it falls just short of Raza, diving forward from deep midwicket
shortish again, whipped down to long-on
down the track and he bowls it straighter, a low full-toss at his feet. Works it away towards deep backward square leg
down the track and he ends up yorking himself. It's flat, full and straight, and it straightens a touch, sneaks under Worker's bat as he goes for the big shot, and crashes into middle and leg stump
very full on middle and off, stabbed back to the bowler
fullish on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
flat and full, looking to cramp Ronchi as he moves away from leg stump, but he manages to get his front leg out of the way and club it away to the left of deep midwicket

a bit slower now and he's down on one knee to slog-sweep over deep midwicket, assisted by what should go down as a drop from Muzarabani, who got both hands to it over his right shoulder but couldn't grab on
shortish outside off, punched away towards deep point
full-toss on off stump, and Ronchi slaps that over the bowler's head, long-off runs around to field it
good change of pace from Raza. Saw him shape for the sweep and bowled it shorter and slower to ping him on the pad. Was bowled from around the wicket, and pitched outside leg
a bit fuller, swiped away towards midwicket
floated up wide of off stump, too full to drive through cover, bottom-edges into the ground, rolls towards the keeper

moves his line a bit straighter and legs it hang in the air. Goes for the slog-sweep and ends up whipping it towards deep backward square leg, where Ervine takes another good catch, tumbling forward to catch it low with both hands
reverse-sweep, takes this slowish length ball from outside leg and slaps it towards deep point
tossed up outside off, and he shuffles across to nurdle it into the on side
flat length ball on leg stump, and that is powerful from Munro, just clears his front leg and smashes that hard over midwicket. Bounces just short of the boundary cushions
down the track and he bowls it flat on middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way again but hits it straighter this time, right out of the screws and over the wide long-on boundary
low full-toss on off stump, driven firmly down the ground towards long-off
length ball on middle and leg, swiped away towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, slower ball, swiped down the ground to long-on
low full-toss on middle stump, stabbed away down to long-off

full on off stump, and there's that power from Munro again, his front leg isn't too close to the pitch of the ball, which gives him room to swing through the line, with a lot of bottom hand, and smack that hard between the stumps and non-striker
this time it isn't as full as the previous ball, and he can get some elevation on that smack down the ground, hits it hard over the umpire
slower ball on middle and off. McCullum slogs across the line and inside-edges it for four, past his leg stump

low full-toss on off stump, and that is smashed. McCullum jumped back and across before the bowler released, went deep in his crease, and made himself lots of swinging room to launch that high and hard over wide long-on
short and wide and McCullum just slashes it away, slicing under the ball to get it up and over the backward point region. Both point and third man were inside the circle, so that was a poor ball
gets the yorker right this time and McCullum tickles it away through backward square leg
slower ball angling into middle and leg stump, and Munro, who is in an open position, can only poke it back to the bowler

ooh, that's a stunning effort from Chakabva. Munro went for the reverse-slap to the back-of-a-length ball from Mpofu, and ended up top-edging it. It looped over the keeper, to his right, and he ran backwards, threw himself full length, and got one glove to the ball but couldn't hold on to it
